name: admin
help: Work with your Power Platform Admin Account

verbs.name: list
verbs.help: List all environments from your tenant.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: List all environments that contain given string in their name or ID.

arguments.name: --type
arguments.help: List all environments with the given type.
arguments.listOfValues: Trial, Sandbox, Production, Developer, Teams, SubscriptionBasedTrial
arguments.listOfDisplayValues: Trial, Sandbox, Production, Developer, Teams, SubscriptionBasedTrial

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: List all environments that contain given string in their name.

arguments.name: --organization-id
arguments.help: List all environments that contain given string in their organization ID.

arguments.name: --application
arguments.help: List all environments that have specified application installed. To specify application, use unique name or ID.

verbs.name: create
verbs.help: Creates a Dataverse instance in your tenant.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: Sets the name of the environment.

arguments.name: --region
arguments.help: Sets the environment's region name. [defaults to unitedstates]

arguments.name: --type
arguments.help: Sets the environment Type.
arguments.listOfValues: Trial, Sandbox, Production, Developer, Teams, SubscriptionBasedTrial
arguments.listOfDisplayValues: Trial, Sandbox, Production, Developer, Teams, SubscriptionBasedTrial

arguments.name: --currency
arguments.help: Sets the currency used for your environment. [defaults to USD]

arguments.name: --language
arguments.help: Sets the language used for your environment. [defaults to English]

arguments.name: --templates
arguments.help: Sets the Dynamics 365 app that needs to be deployed, passed as comma separated values. For example: -tm "D365_Sample, D365_Sales"

arguments.name: --domain
arguments.help: The domain name is part of the environment URL. If domain name is already in use, a numeric value is appended to the domain name. For example: If 'contoso' is already in use, then the environment URL is updated to https://{contoso}0.crm.dynamics.com.
arguments.RegexHelp: Only characters within the ranges [A - Z], [a - z], [0 - 9], or '-' are allowed. The first and last character can't be the '-' character. Consecutive '-' characters aren't allowed.

arguments.name: --input-file
arguments.help: The verb arguments to be passed in a .json input file. For example: {"name" : "contoso"}. The arguments passed through command-line will take precedence over arguments from the .json input file.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

arguments.name: --team-id
arguments.help: Team ID as Guid
arguments.RegexHelp: The Team Id must be a valid Guid.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

verbs.name: backup
verbs.help: Takes a manual backup of your environment.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the Environment that requires backup.

arguments.name: --label
arguments.help: Sets the backup label as provided.

arguments.name: --notes
arguments.help: **ignored**: Additional notes for this backup.

verbs.name: set-backup-retention-period
verbs.help: Takes a manual backup of your environment.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the Environment that requires backup.

arguments.name: --backup-retention-period
arguments.help: Sets the backup retention period in days as provided. Valid values are: 7, 14, 21, 28.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

verbs.name: delete
verbs.help: Deletes the environment from your tenant.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the Environment that needs to be deleted from your tenant.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

verbs.name: reset
verbs.help: Reset the environment from your tenant.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: URL or ID of the Environment that needs to be reset.

arguments.name: --currency
arguments.help: Sets the currency used for your environment. [defaults to USD]

arguments.name: --domain
arguments.help: The domain name is part of the environment URL. If domain name is already in use, a numeric value is appended to the domain name. For example: If 'contoso' is already in use, then the environment URL is updated to https://{contoso}0.crm.dynamics.com.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: Sets the name of the environment.

arguments.name: --language
arguments.help: Sets the language used for your environment. [defaults to English]

arguments.name: --purpose
arguments.help: Sets the description used to associate the environment with a specific intent.

arguments.name: --templates
arguments.help: Sets the Dynamics 365 app that needs to be deployed, passed as comma separated values. For example: -tm "D365_Sample, D365_Sales"

arguments.name: --input-file
arguments.help: The verb arguments to be passed in a .json input file. For example: {"name" : "contoso"}. The arguments passed through command-line will take precedence over arguments from the .json input file.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

verbs.name: list-backups
verbs.help: Lists all backups of your environment.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: List all environments that contain a given string in their Environment ID or URL.

verbs.name: restore
verbs.help: Restores an environment to a given backup.

arguments.name: --source-env
arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the source environment required for restore.

arguments.name: --target-env
arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the target environment required for restore. This would default to source URL/ID if not provided.

arguments.name: --selected-backup
arguments.help: DateTime of the backup in 'mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm' format OR string 'latest'.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: Optional name of the restored environment.

arguments.name: --skip-audit-data
arguments.help: Switch indicating whether audit data should be skipped

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

verbs.name: copy
verbs.help: Copy Source Environment to Destination Environment.

arguments.name: --source-env
arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the source environment that is being copied

arguments.name: --target-env
arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the target environment.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: Name of the target environment.

arguments.name: --skip-audit-data
arguments.help: Switch indicating whether audit data should be skipped

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

verbs.name: status
verbs.help: This command lists the status of all the operations in progress.

verbs.name: assign-user
verbs.help: Assign a user to a target Dataverse environment with specified security role.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: ID or URL of the environment to assign a user to.

arguments.name: --user
arguments.help: Object ID or user principal name (UPN) of Azure Active Directory user to be assigned to the environment or Application ID if assigning an Application User.

arguments.name: --role
arguments.help: Name or ID of security role to be applied to user

arguments.name: --application-user
arguments.help: Specifies whether the input user is an application user. If a business unit isn't specified, the application user is added to the authenticated users business unit.

arguments.name: --business-unit
arguments.help: ID of business unit to associate application user with.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

verbs.name: assign-group
verbs.help: Assign group to target Dataverse environment with specified security role.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: ID or URL of the environment to assign a user to.

arguments.name: --group
arguments.help: Azure Active Directory object ID of group to assign to target Dataverse environment.

arguments.name: --group-name
arguments.help: Name of the group or team to create in Dataverse.

arguments.name: --role
arguments.help: Name or ID of security role to be applied to user

arguments.name: --team-type
arguments.help: Type of team.

arguments.name: --membership-type
arguments.help: Team membership type.

arguments.name: --business-unit
arguments.help: ID of business unit to associate application user with.

verbs.name: list-app-templates
verbs.help: Lists all supported Dataverse templates of model-driven apps in Dynamics 365.

arguments.name: --region
arguments.help: Sets the environment's region name. [defaults to unitedstates]

verbs.name: create-service-principal
verbs.help: Add Microsoft Azure Active Directory application and associated application user to the Dataverse environment.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: ID or URL of the environment to add an application user to.

arguments.name: --role
arguments.help: Name or ID of security role to be applied to application user. The default value is: 'System Administrator'.

name: application
help: Commands for listing and installing available Dataverse applications from AppSource

verbs.name: list
verbs.help: List available Dataverse applications from AppSource

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: List available Dataverse applications for given environment (by ID or url); if not specified, list all applications in the tenant

arguments.name: --output
arguments.help: Location of the JSON file to be created with list of the Dataverse applications from AppSource

arguments.name: --installState
arguments.help: Filter by application install state

verbs.name: install
verbs.help: Installs Dataverse application to given environment.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: List available Dataverse applications for given environment (by ID or url); if not specified, list all applications in the tenant

arguments.name: --application-name
arguments.help: Unique name of the application to install to the target environment.

arguments.name: --application-list
arguments.help: Location of the JSON file with list of the Dataverse applications from AppSource to be installed

name: auth
help: Manage how you authenticate to various services

verbs.name: create
verbs.help: Create and store authentication profiles on this computer

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: The name you want to give to this authentication profile (maximum 30 characters).
arguments.RegexHelp: The length of the name should be between 1 and 30

arguments.name: --kind
arguments.help: The kind of authentication profile you're creating.

arguments.name: --url
arguments.help: The resource URL to connect to

arguments.name: --username
arguments.help: Optional: The username to authenticate with; shows Azure Active Directory dialog if not specified.

arguments.name: --password
arguments.help: Optional: The password to authenticate with

arguments.name: --applicationId
arguments.help: Optional: The application ID to authenticate with.

arguments.name: --clientSecret
arguments.help: Optional: The client secret to authenticate with

arguments.name: --certificateDiskPath
arguments.help: Optional: The certificate disk path to authenticate with

arguments.name: --certificatePassword
arguments.help: Optional: The certificate password to authenticate with

arguments.name: --tenant
arguments.help: Tenant ID if using application ID/client secret or application ID/client certificate.

arguments.name: --cloud
arguments.help: Optional: The cloud instance to authenticate with
arguments.listOfValues: Public, Preprod, Test, UsGov, UsGovHigh, UsGovDod, China

arguments.name: --deviceCode
arguments.help: Use the Azure Active Directory Device Code flow for interactive sign-in.

arguments.name: --managedIdentity
arguments.help: Use Azure Managed Identity.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Default environment (ID, url, unique name, or partial name).

verbs.name: list
verbs.help: List the authentication profiles stored on this computer

verbs.name: select
verbs.help: Select which authentication profile should be active

arguments.name: --index
arguments.help: The index of the profile to be active.
arguments.RegexHelp: The value must be a positive integer.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: The name of the profile to be active
arguments.RegexHelp: The length of the name should be between 1 and 30

verbs.name: delete
verbs.help: Delete a particular authentication profile

arguments.name: --index
arguments.help: The index of the profile to be deleted
arguments.RegexHelp: The value must be a positive integer.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: The name of the profile to be active
arguments.RegexHelp: The length of the name should be between 1 and 30

verbs.name: update
verbs.help: Update name or target environment of an existing authentication profile

arguments.name: --index
arguments.help: The index of the profile to be named/renamed
arguments.RegexHelp: The value must be a positive integer.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: The name you want to give to this authentication profile (maximum 30 characters).

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Default environment (ID, url, unique name, or partial name).

verbs.name: name
verbs.help: Name or rename an existing authentication profile

arguments.name: --index
arguments.help: The index of the profile to be named/renamed
arguments.RegexHelp: The value must be a positive integer.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: The name you want to give to this authentication profile (maximum 30 characters).
arguments.RegexHelp: The length of the name should be between 1 and 30

verbs.name: clear
verbs.help: Clear all authentication profiles stored on this computer

name: canvas
help: Operating with Power Apps .msapp files

verbs.name: pack
verbs.help: (Preview) Pack sources into an msapp file

arguments.name: --sources
arguments.help: Directory to sources to be packed

arguments.name: --msapp
arguments.help: Path to .msapp file

verbs.name: unpack
verbs.help: (Preview) Extract an msapp file into sources

arguments.name: --sources
arguments.help: Directory to sources to be unpacked

arguments.name: --msapp
arguments.help: Path to .msapp file

verbs.name: create
verbs.help: Generate a canvas app from a custom connector

arguments.name: --msapp
arguments.help: Path to .msapp file to be generated

arguments.name: --connector-id
arguments.help: The ID of the Connector to generate the Power App from.

arguments.name: --connector-display-name
arguments.help: The display name of the Connector to generate the Power App from.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile.

name: catalog
help: (Preview) Commands for working with Catalog in Power Platform

verbs.name: list
verbs.help: (Preview) List all published catalog items from the current Dataverse organization.

arguments.name: --catalog-item-name
arguments.help: Catalog item name to search for.

arguments.name: --catalog-item-id
arguments.help: Catalog item ID to search for. When catalog item ID is used, catalog item name is ignored.

arguments.name: --include-active
arguments.help: Include active items.

verbs.name: submit
verbs.help: (Preview) Submit catalog approval request.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path to catalog submission document

arguments.name: --package-zip
arguments.help: Path to package zip file.

arguments.name: --solution-zip
arguments.help: Path to solution zip file.

arguments.name: --poll-status
arguments.help: Poll to check status of your request

verbs.name: install
verbs.help: (Preview) Install a catalog item to the target environment.

arguments.name: --catalog-item-id
arguments.help: Catalog item to be installed on the target environment.

arguments.name: --target-url
arguments.help: Url of the target environment for catalog item installation

arguments.name: --settings
arguments.help: Runtime Package Settings for the installation framework to execute. The format of the string must be `key=value|key=value`.
arguments.RegexHelp: The format of the string must be `key=value|key=value`.

arguments.name: --target-version
arguments.help: Target version to install. If left empty, the published version is selected.

arguments.name: --poll-status
arguments.help: Poll to check status of your request

verbs.name: status
verbs.help: (Preview) Get status of the catalog install/submit request.

arguments.name: --tracking-id
arguments.help: Request tracking ID.

arguments.name: --type
arguments.help: Request type

verbs.name: update
verbs.help: (Preview) Update settings for the catalog.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path to catalog settings document

verbs.name: create-submission
verbs.help: (Preview) Create catalog submission document. Note: This command will be removed in a future release.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path to catalog submission document

verbs.name: list

arguments.name: --api-properties-file

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile.

arguments.name: --connector-id

arguments.RegexHelp: The Connector ID must be a valid Guid.

arguments.name: --api-definition-file
arguments.help: The filename and path to read the Connector's OpenApiDefinition.

arguments.name: --api-properties-file
arguments.help: The filename and path to read the Connector's API Properties file.

arguments.name: --icon-file
arguments.help: The filename and path to and Icon .png file.

arguments.name: --script-file
arguments.help: The filename and path to a Script .csx file.

arguments.name: --solution-unique-name
arguments.help: The unique name of the solution to add the connector to

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile.

arguments.name: --settings-file

name: copilot
help: (Preview) Tools and utilities for copilot scenarios

verbs.name: list
verbs.help: AI Builder models in the current environment.

verbs.name: predict
verbs.help: Sends text or prompt to AI Model

arguments.name: --model-id
arguments.help: AI Builder model Id

arguments.name: --prompt
arguments.help: Prompt to send to AI Model

arguments.name: --text
arguments.help: Text to send to AI Model

verbs.name: prepare-fetch
verbs.help: Takes the FetchXML file from the AI Large Language Model (LLM) and prepares it for execution against the current environment.

arguments.name: --inputFile
arguments.help: Input FetchXML file that usually comes from AI LLM.

arguments.name: --outputFile
arguments.help: Output FetchXML file that is ready to execute against the current environment.

name: data
help: Import and export data from Dataverse.

verbs.name: export
verbs.help: Export data

arguments.name: --schemaFile
arguments.help: Schema file name. It can be created using the Configuration Migration Tool.

arguments.name: --dataFile
arguments.help: File name for data zip file. Default data.zip

arguments.name: --overwrite
arguments.help: Allow overwrite of the output data file if it already exists.

arguments.name: --verbose
arguments.help: Output more diagnostic information during data import/export

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Environment (ID, org ID, url, unique name, or partial name).

verbs.name: import
verbs.help: Import data

arguments.name: --dataDirectory
arguments.help: Directory name with data for import.

arguments.name: --data
arguments.help: Zip file or directory name with data for import.

arguments.name: --verbose
arguments.help: Output more diagnostic information during data import/export

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Environment (ID, org ID, url, unique name, or partial name).

name: help
help: Show help for the Microsoft Power Platform CLI.

name: modelbuilder
help: Code Generator for Dataverse APIs and Tables

verbs.name: build
verbs.help: Builds a code model for Dataverse APIs and Tables

arguments.name: --suppressGeneratedCodeAttribute
arguments.help: When set, this suppress all generated objects being tagged with the code generation engine and version

arguments.name: --language
arguments.help: The language to use for the generated proxy code. This value can be either 'CS' or 'VB'. The default language is 'CS'.

arguments.name: --namespace
arguments.help: The namespace for the generated code. The default namespace is the global namespace.

arguments.name: --serviceContextName
arguments.help: The name for the generated service context. If a value is passed in, it's used for the Service Context. If not, no Service Context is generated.

arguments.name: --generatesdkmessages
arguments.help: When set, emits Sdk message classes as part of code generation.

arguments.name: --emitentityetc
arguments.help: When set, includes the entity ETC ( entity type code ) in the generated code.

arguments.name: --emitvirtualattributes
arguments.help: When set, includes the Virtual Attributes of entities in the generated code.

arguments.name: --emitfieldsclasses
arguments.help: Generate a constants structure that contains all of the field names by entity at the time of code generation.

arguments.name: --entitynamesfilter
arguments.help: Filters the list of entities are retrieved when reading data from Dataverse. Passed in as a semicolon separated list. Using the form <entitylogicalname>;<entitylogicalname>

arguments.name: --messagenamesfilter
arguments.help: Filters the list of messages that are retrieved when reading data from Dataverse. Passed in as a semicolon separated list, required messages (Create, Update, Delete, Retrieve, RetrieveMultiple, Associate and Disassociate) are always included. Use a trailing or leading asterisk (*) with the names of the messages to allow for all messages starting with or ending with a string. Using the form <messagename>;<messagename>.

arguments.name: --outdirectory
arguments.help: Write directory for entity, message, and optionset files.

arguments.name: --entitytypesfolder
arguments.help: Folder name that contains entities. The default name is 'Entities'.

arguments.name: --messagestypesfolder
arguments.help: Folder name that contains messages. The default name is 'Messages'.

arguments.name: --optionsetstypesfolder
arguments.help: Folder name that contains option sets. The default name is 'OptionSets'.

arguments.name: --generateGlobalOptionSets
arguments.help: Emit all Global OptionSets. Note: If an entity contains a reference to a global optionset, it is emitted even if this switch is not present.

arguments.name: --writesettingsTemplateFile
arguments.help: When set, writes a settings file out to the output directory with the current passed settings or default settings.

arguments.name: --settingsTemplateFile
arguments.help: Contains Settings to be used for this run of the Dataverse Model Builder, overrides any duplicate parameters on command line. Can't be set when --writesettingstemplate is used.

arguments.name: --suppressINotifyPattern
arguments.help: When enabled, doesn't write the INotify wrappers for properties and classes.

arguments.name: --logLevel
arguments.help: Log level. The default value is 'Off'.
arguments.listOfValues: Off, Critical, Error, Warning, Information, Verbose, ActivityTracing, All
arguments.listOfDisplayValues: Off, Critical, Error, Warning, Information, Verbose, ActivityTracing, All

name: org
help: Work with your Dataverse organization.

verbs.name: who
verbs.help: Displays information about the current Dataverse organization.

verbs.name: list
verbs.help: Lists all of the Dataverse organizations the user has access to

arguments.name: --filter
arguments.help: Show only environments containing filter criteria.

verbs.name: fetch
verbs.help: (Preview) Performs FetchXML query against Dataverse

arguments.name: --xml
arguments.help: FetchXML query to run

arguments.name: --xmlFile
arguments.help: File with FetchXML query to run

verbs.name: list-settings
verbs.help: List environment settings

arguments.name: --filter
arguments.help: Show only settings containing filter criteria

verbs.name: update-settings
verbs.help: Update environment settings

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: Name of the setting to update

arguments.name: --value
arguments.help: Value to which setting should be updated to

verbs.name: select
verbs.help: Select default organization for current authentication profile.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Default environment (ID, url, unique name, or partial name).

name: package
help: Commands for working with Dataverse package projects

verbs.name: init
verbs.help: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse package project

arguments.name: --outputDirectory
arguments.help: Output directory

arguments.name: --package-name
arguments.help: Sets the default name of the package. Applies to the generation of ImportExtension.GetNameOfImport.

verbs.name: add-external-package
verbs.help: Adds a package that is external to the Dataverse solution system to a Package Deployer Package project.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path to the external package

arguments.name: --package-type
arguments.help: The type of the package being added. For example: 'xpp' for FnO packages.

arguments.name: --import-order
arguments.help: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

arguments.name: --skip-validation
arguments.help: Adds the item to the project file even if the file doesn't exist or appears to be invalid. Note: Using this doesn't affect any validation performed by MSBuild.

verbs.name: add-solution
verbs.help: Adds a prebuilt Dataverse solution file to a Package Deployer Package project.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path to the Dataverse solution file. The file must be a compressed ZIP file.

arguments.name: --import-order
arguments.help: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

arguments.name: --skip-validation
arguments.help: Adds the item to the project file even if the file doesn't exist or appears to be invalid. Note: Using this doesn't affect any validation performed by MSBuild.

arguments.name: --publish-workflows-activate-plugins
arguments.help: Explicitly indicates whether to publish the workflows and activate plug-ins when this solution is imported.

arguments.name: --overwrite-unmanaged-customizations
arguments.help: Explicitly indicates whether to overwrite unmanaged customizations when this solution is imported.

arguments.name: --import-mode
arguments.help: Explicitly specifies the required mode when importing this solution.

arguments.name: --missing-dependency-behavior
arguments.help: Specifies the behavior on import when a dependency of this solution is missing from the target environment.

arguments.name: --dependency-overrides
arguments.help: A semicolon delimited list of overrides. This value overrides any dependency information encoded in the solution's metadata. Each override should be in the format: `<uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>`. Where minVersion and maxVersion are optional but should be in .NET version format syntax.
arguments.RegexHelp: Use a semicolon delimited list of dependency overrides of the format <uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>.

verbs.name: add-reference
verbs.help: Adds reference to Dataverse solution project

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: The path to the referenced Dataverse solution project

arguments.name: --import-order
arguments.help: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

arguments.name: --publish-workflows-activate-plugins
arguments.help: Explicitly indicates whether to publish the workflows and activate plug-ins when this solution is imported.

arguments.name: --overwrite-unmanaged-customizations
arguments.help: Explicitly indicates whether to overwrite unmanaged customizations when this solution is imported.

arguments.name: --import-mode
arguments.help: Explicitly specifies the required mode when importing this solution.

arguments.name: --missing-dependency-behavior
arguments.help: Specifies the behavior on import when a dependency of this solution is missing from the target environment.

arguments.name: --dependency-overrides
arguments.help: A semicolon delimited list of overrides. This value overrides any dependency information encoded in the solution's metadata. Each override should be in the format: `<uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>`. Where minVersion and maxVersion are optional but should be in .NET version format syntax.
arguments.RegexHelp: Use a semicolon delimited list of dependency overrides of the format <uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>.

verbs.name: deploy
verbs.help: Deploys package to Dataverse

arguments.name: --logFile
arguments.help: Log file path

arguments.name: --logConsole
arguments.help: Output log to console

arguments.name: --package
arguments.help: Path to a package dll or zip file with a package.

arguments.name: --settings
arguments.help: Runtime Package Settings that are passed to the package that is being deployed. The format of the string must be `key=value|key=value`.
arguments.RegexHelp: The format of the string must be `key=value|key=value`.

arguments.name: --verbose
arguments.help: Emit verbose logs to the log outputs.

verbs.name: show
verbs.help: Shows details of Dataverse package

arguments.name: --package
arguments.help: Path to a package dll or zip file with a package.

arguments.name: --logFile
arguments.help: Log file path

arguments.name: --verbose
arguments.help: Emit verbose logs to the log outputs.

name: paportal
help: Commands for working with Power Pages website.

verbs.name: list
verbs.help: List all Power Pages websites from the current Dataverse environment.

arguments.name: --verbose
arguments.help: Enables verbose mode to provide more details.

verbs.name: download
verbs.help: Download Power Pages website content from the current Dataverse environment.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path where the Power Pages website content is downloaded

arguments.name: --webSiteId
arguments.help: Power Pages website ID to download

arguments.name: --includeEntities
arguments.help: Download only the entities specified for this argument using comma separated entity logical names.

arguments.name: --excludeEntities
arguments.help: Comma separated list of entity logical names to exclude downloading

arguments.name: --overwrite
arguments.help: Power Pages website content to overwrite

arguments.name: --modelVersion
arguments.help: Power Pages website data model version to download.

verbs.name: upload
verbs.help: Upload Power Pages website content to current Dataverse environment.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path from where the Power Pages website content is uploaded.

arguments.name: --deploymentProfile
arguments.help: Deployment profile name to be used. Defaults to 'default'

arguments.name: --forceUploadAll
arguments.help: Upload all Power Pages website content to the current Dataverse environment.

arguments.name: --modelVersion
arguments.help: Power Pages website data model version to upload.

name: pcf
help: Commands for working with Power Apps component framework projects

verbs.name: init
verbs.help: Initializes a directory with a new Power Apps component framework project

arguments.name: --namespace
arguments.help: The namespace for the component.
arguments.RegexHelp: Only characters within the ranges [A - Z], [a - z], [0 - 9], or '.' are allowed. The first and last character may not be the '.' character. Consecutive '.' characters are not allowed. Numbers are not allowed as the first character or immediately after a period.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: The name for the component.
arguments.RegexHelp: Only characters within the ranges [A - Z], [a - z] or [0 - 9] are allowed. The first character may not be a number.

arguments.name: --template
arguments.help: Choose a template for the component.

arguments.name: --framework
arguments.help: The rendering framework for control. The default value is 'none', which means HTML.

arguments.name: --outputDirectory
arguments.help: Output directory

arguments.name: --run-npm-install
arguments.help: Auto run 'npm install' after the control is created. The default value is 'false'.

verbs.name: push
verbs.help: Import the Power Apps component framework project into the current Dataverse organization

arguments.name: --publisher-prefix
arguments.help: Customization prefix value for the Dataverse solution publisher
arguments.RegexHelp: The prefix must be 2 to 8 characters long, can only consist of alpha-numerics, must start with a letter, and can't start with 'mscrm'.

arguments.name: --verbosity
arguments.help: Verbosity level for MSBuild when building the temporary solution wrapper.

arguments.name: --force-import
arguments.help: Force a full update of the control

arguments.name: --interactive
arguments.help: Indicates that actions in the build are allowed to interact with the user. Don't use this argument in an automated scenario where interactivity is not expected.

verbs.name: version
verbs.help: Patch version for controls

arguments.name: --strategy
arguments.help: Updates patch version for 'ControlManifest.xml' files using specified strategy. If using gittags, set a personal access token in the following environment variable "PacCli.PAT"

arguments.name: --patchversion
arguments.help: Patch version for controls
arguments.RegexHelp: The value must be a positive integer.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Absolute/Relative path of the 'ControlManifest.xml' for updating.

arguments.name: --allmanifests
arguments.help: Updates patch version for all 'ControlManifest.xml' files

arguments.name: --updatetarget
arguments.help: Specify which target manifest needs to be updated.

arguments.name: --filename
arguments.help: Tracker CSV file name to be used when using filetracking as a strategy. The default value is 'ControlsStateVersionInfo.csv'.

name: pipeline
help: Work with Pipelines

verbs.name: list
verbs.help: List Pipelines

arguments.name: --pipeline
arguments.help: Pipeline name or ID for which show list of details such as deployment stages

verbs.name: deploy
verbs.help: Start pipeline deployment.

arguments.name: --solutionName
arguments.help: Solution Name

arguments.name: --stageId
arguments.help: Deployment Stage ID

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Deployment Environment

arguments.name: --currentVersion
arguments.help: Current solution version

arguments.name: --newVersion
arguments.help: New solution version

arguments.name: --wait
arguments.help: Wait until the deployment finishes.

verbs.help: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse plug-in class library.

arguments.name: --signing-key-file-path
arguments.help: Relative path to the Dataverse plug-in assembly originator key file for signing.

arguments.name: --outputDirectory
arguments.help: Output directory

arguments.name: --author
arguments.help: One or more authors of the Dataverse Plug-in Package.

arguments.name: --skip-signing
arguments.help: Skip plug-in assembly signing that gives the plug-in assembly a strong name. The default value is 'false'.

verbs.name: push
verbs.help: Import plug-in into Dataverse.

arguments.name: --pluginId
arguments.help: ID of plug-in assembly or plug-in package

arguments.name: --pluginFile
arguments.help: File name of plug-in assembly or plug-in package

arguments.name: --type
arguments.help: Type of item if not specified explicitly through --pluginFile. The default value is: 'Nuget'.

arguments.name: --configuration
arguments.help: Build configuration. The default value is: 'Debug'.

name: solution
help: Commands for working with Dataverse solution projects

verbs.name: init
verbs.help: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse solution project

arguments.name: --publisher-name
arguments.help: Name of the Dataverse solution publisher
arguments.RegexHelp: Only characters within the ranges [A - Z], [a - z], [0 - 9], or _ are allowed. The first character may only be in the ranges [A - Z], [a - z], or _.

arguments.name: --publisher-prefix
arguments.help: Customization prefix value for the Dataverse solution publisher
arguments.RegexHelp: The prefix must be 2 to 8 characters long, can only consist of alpha-numerics, must start with a letter, and can't start with 'mscrm'.

arguments.name: --outputDirectory
arguments.help: Output directory

verbs.name: add-reference
verbs.help: Adds a reference from the project in the current directory to the project at 'path'

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: The path to the referenced project

verbs.name: list
verbs.help: List all Solutions from the current Dataverse organization

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: The target Environment ID or URL. The default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile.

verbs.name: delete
verbs.help: Delete a solution from Dataverse in the current environment.

arguments.name: --solution-name
arguments.help: Name of the solution.

verbs.name: online-version
verbs.help: Sets version for solution loaded in Dataverse.

arguments.name: --solution-name
arguments.help: Name of the solution.

arguments.name: --solution-version
arguments.help: Specify the solution version number.

verbs.name: version
verbs.help: Update build or revision version for the solution.

arguments.name: --strategy
arguments.help: Updates build version for 'Solution.xml' file using specified strategy. If using gittags, set personal access token in the following environment variable "PacCli.PAT"

arguments.name: --patchversion
arguments.help: Patch version for the solution.

arguments.name: --buildversion
arguments.help: Build version for the solution.
arguments.RegexHelp: The value must be a positive integer.

arguments.name: --revisionversion
arguments.help: Revision version for the solution.
arguments.RegexHelp: The value must be a positive integer.

arguments.name: --filename
arguments.help: Tracker CSV file name to be used when using filetracking as a strategy. The default value is 'ControlsStateVersionInfo.csv'.

arguments.name: --solutionPath
arguments.help: Path to Dataverse solution directory or Solution.xml file.

verbs.name: import
verbs.help: Import the solution into Dataverse.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path to solution zip file. If not specified, assumes the current folder is a cdsproj project.

arguments.name: --activate-plugins
arguments.help: Activate plug-ins and workflows on the solution.

arguments.name: --force-overwrite
arguments.help: Force an overwrite of unmanaged customizations

arguments.name: --skip-dependency-check
arguments.help: Skip dependency check against dependencies flagged as product update

arguments.name: --import-as-holding
arguments.help: Import the solution as a holding solution.

arguments.name: --publish-changes
arguments.help: Publish your changes upon a successful import.

arguments.name: --convert-to-managed
arguments.help: Convert to a managed solution.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Imports the solution asynchronously.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

arguments.name: --settings-file
arguments.help: The .json file with the deployment settings for connection references and environment variables.

arguments.name: --skip-lower-version
arguments.help: Skip solution import if same or higher version is present in current environment.

verbs.name: export
verbs.help: Export a solution from Dataverse.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: The name of the solution to be exported.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path where the exported solution zip file is written.

arguments.name: --managed
arguments.help: Whether the solution should be exported as a managed solution.

arguments.name: --targetversion
arguments.help: The version that the exported solution will support

arguments.name: --include
arguments.help: Which settings should be included in the solution being exported.
arguments.listOfValues: autonumbering, calendar, customization, emailtracking, externalapplications, general, isvconfig, marketing, outlooksynchronization, relationshiproles, sales
arguments.listOfDisplayValues: autonumbering, calendar, customization, emailtracking, externalapplications, general, isvconfig, marketing, outlooksynchronization, relationshiproles, sales

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Exports the solution asynchronously.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

arguments.name: --overwrite
arguments.help: The exported solution file can overwrite the solution zip file on the local file system.

verbs.name: clone
verbs.help: Create a solution project based on an existing solution in your organization.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: The name of the solution to be exported.

arguments.name: --targetversion
arguments.help: The version that the exported solution will support

arguments.name: --include
arguments.help: Which settings should be included in the solution being exported.
arguments.listOfValues: autonumbering, calendar, customization, emailtracking, externalapplications, general, isvconfig, marketing, outlooksynchronization, relationshiproles, sales
arguments.listOfDisplayValues: autonumbering, calendar, customization, emailtracking, externalapplications, general, isvconfig, marketing, outlooksynchronization, relationshiproles, sales

arguments.name: --outputDirectory
arguments.help: Output directory

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Exports the solution asynchronously.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

arguments.name: --processCanvasApps
arguments.help: (Preview) Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. The default value is 'false'.

arguments.name: --packagetype
arguments.help: Specifies the extraction type for the solution. Can be: 'Unmanaged', 'Managed' or 'Both'. The default value is: 'Both'.

arguments.name: --localize
arguments.help: Extract or merge all string resources into .resx files.

verbs.name: publish
verbs.help: Publishes all customizations

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Publishes all customizations asynchronously

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

verbs.name: upgrade
verbs.help: Option to stage the Dataverse solution for upgrade

arguments.name: --solution-name
arguments.help: Name of the solution.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Upgrades solution asynchronously

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. The default value is 60 minutes.

verbs.name: add-license
verbs.help: Add license and plan info to the solution.

arguments.name: --planDefinitionFile
arguments.help: License plan definition file in CSV format; expected columns: Service ID, Display name, More info URL.

arguments.name: --planMappingFile
arguments.help: License plan mapping file in CSV format; expected columns: Service ID, Component name

verbs.name: check
verbs.help: Upload a Dataverse solution project to run against the Power Apps Checker service.

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path where one or more solution files to be checked exist. The path can contain glob/wildcard characters.

arguments.name: --solutionUrl
arguments.help: SAS Uri pointing to solution.zip to be analyzed

arguments.name: --outputDirectory
arguments.help: Output directory

arguments.name: --geo
arguments.help: Which geographical instance of the Power Apps Checker service to use.
arguments.listOfValues: PreviewUnitedStates, UnitedStates, Europe, Asia, Australia, Japan, India, Canada, SouthAmerica, UnitedKingdom, France, SouthAfrica, Germany, UnitedArabEmirates, Switzerland, Norway, Singapore, Korea, USGovernment, USGovernmentL4, USGovernmentL5DoD, China
arguments.listOfDisplayValues: PreviewUnitedStates, UnitedStates, Europe, Asia, Australia, Japan, India, Canada, SouthAmerica, UnitedKingdom, France, SouthAfrica, Germany, UnitedArabEmirates, Switzerland, Norway, Singapore, Korea, USGovernment, USGovernmentL4, USGovernmentL5DoD, China

arguments.name: --customEndpoint
arguments.help: Specify a custom URL as the Power Apps Checker endpoint.

arguments.name: --ruleLevelOverride
arguments.help: Path to a file containing a JSON array rules and levels to override. Accepted values for OverrideLevel are: Critical, High, Medium, Low, Informational. Example: [{"Id":"meta-remove-dup-reg","OverrideLevel":"Medium"},{"Id":"il-avoid-specialized-update-ops","OverrideLevel":"Medium"}]

arguments.name: --ruleSet
arguments.help: Select a rule set that is executed as part of this build. Values: A valid Guid, "AppSource Certification", "Solution Checker" (default).

arguments.name: --excludedFiles
arguments.help: Exclude Files from the Analysis. Pass as comma-separated values

arguments.name: --saveResults
arguments.help: Uses current environment to store solution analysis results that can be seen in Solution Health Hub App. By default, this argument is set to false.

verbs.name: create-settings
verbs.help: Create a settings file from solution zip or solution folder.

arguments.name: --solution-zip
arguments.help: Path to solution zip file.

arguments.name: --solution-folder
arguments.help: Path to the local, unpacked solution folder: either the root of the 'Other/Solution.xml' file or a folder with a .cdsproj file.

arguments.name: --settings-file
arguments.help: The .json file with the deployment settings for connection references and environment variables.

verbs.name: pack
verbs.help: Package solution components on local filesystem into solution.zip (SolutionPackager).

arguments.name: --zipfile
arguments.help: The full path to the solution ZIP file

arguments.name: --folder
arguments.help: The path to the root folder on the local filesystem. When unpacking or extracting, this is written to. When packing this is read from.

arguments.name: --packagetype
arguments.help: When unpacking or extracting, use to specify dual Managed and Unmanaged operation. When packing, use to specify Managed or Unmanaged from a previous unpack 'Both'. Can be: 'Unmanaged', 'Managed' or 'Both'. The default value is 'Unmanaged'.

arguments.name: --log
arguments.help: The path to the log file.

arguments.name: --errorlevel
arguments.help: Minimum logging level for log output [Verbose|Info|Warning|Error|Off]. The default value is 'Info'.

arguments.name: --singleComponent
arguments.help: Only perform action on a single component type [WebResource|Plugin|Workflow|None]. The default value is 'None'.

arguments.name: --allowDelete
arguments.help: Dictates if delete operations may occur. The default value is 'false'.

arguments.name: --allowWrite
arguments.help: Dictates if write operations may occur. The default value is 'false'.

arguments.name: --clobber
arguments.help: Enables that files marked read-only can be deleted or overwritten. The default value is 'false'.

arguments.name: --map
arguments.help: The full path to a mapping xml file from which to read component folders to pack.

arguments.name: --sourceLoc
arguments.help: Generates a template resource file. Valid only on extract. Possible values are 'auto', or language code of the language you wish to export. You can use Language Code Identifier (LCID), or International Organization for Standardization (ISO) language code formats. When present, this extracts the string resources from the given locale as a neutral .resx. If 'auto' or just the long or short form of the switch is specified, the base locale for the solution is used.

arguments.name: --localize
arguments.help: Extract or merge all string resources into .resx files.

arguments.name: --useLcid
arguments.help: Use Language Code Identifier (LCID) values (1033) rather than International Organization for Standardization (ISO) codes (en-US) for language files.

arguments.name: --useUnmanagedFileForMissingManaged
arguments.help: Use the same XML source file when packaging for Managed and only Unmanaged XML file is found; applies to AppModuleSiteMap, AppModuleMap, FormXml files.

arguments.name: --disablePluginRemap
arguments.help: Disabled plug-in fully qualified type name remapping. The default value is 'false'.

arguments.name: --processCanvasApps
arguments.help: (Preview) Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. The default value is 'false'.
